subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Zoroastrianism: The Religion That Shaped All Others
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Zoroastrianism: The Religion That Shaped All Others.

hook.text: Heaven, hell, angels, demons, a savior, and a final judgment. These ideas all came from one forgotten religion.

buildup.text: Zoroastrianism was founded by Zarathustra in ancient Persia around 1500 BCE. It was the world's first ethical religion.

discovery.text: Zoroaster taught that one good God (Ahura Mazda) fights one evil spirit (Angra Mainyu). The universe is a moral battle.

twist.text: Judaism absorbed Zoroastrian ideas during the Babylonian exile. Angels, Satan, and resurrection entered the Bible there.

climax.text: Christianity, Islam, and Judaism all carry Zoroastrian DNA. The most influential religion is the one nobody remembers.

punchline.text: Heaven, hell, and the devil? Zoroastrianism invented them all first.

quiz.question: What concepts did Zoroastrianism contribute to later religions?
options: Heaven, hell, angels, demons, and final judgment
